snippet: A two-part study of Saudi textbooks commissioned by the State Department and conducted by the International Center for Religion and Diplomacy, a Washington research group, was finished in 2013 but was never released for fear of angering Saudi offi...
lead_paragraph: A two-part study of Saudi textbooks commissioned by the State Department and conducted by the International Center for Religion and Diplomacy, a Washington research group, was finished in 2013 but was never released for fear of angering Saudi officials. The New York Times obtained a copy under the Freedom of Information Act.

headline.main: State Dept. Study on Saudi Textbooks
